text: Bottle courtesy of Reynolds314, thanks! Shared at Salud bottle share. Hazy golden yellow color color. Nice aroma of bretty dust and pepper, white wine, stone fruit. Taste is smooth fruity and vinous with light funk, maybe a hint of juniper. Delicious.

Bottle - thanks Phil! Pours slightly hazy golden, small off-white head, decent lacing. Aroma is oak, Brett, lemon, peaches, juniper berries, gin. Flavor is light plus tart, medium funky, loads of oak tannins, slight vinous notes with genever ever present. Medium body, Interesting.

Aroma: Gin, Red Wine, Mild Stone Fruit...
Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head, Some Lacing...
Taste: Gin, Hay, Red Wine, Apricot, Mild Dry Hopping Finish...
Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Tart
Shared at Craft. Poured hazy straw with white head. Nose was white wine grapes, yeasty oak, hops, mild funk. Tasted tart, winey, fruity, with notes of oak, hops, and a champagney body.
Shared bottle at Aarons. Tart lemon and light body. Yellow in color. Some apple notes.

Bottle at amazing tasting 30th birthday of Alexander. Many thanks again!
APPEARANCE: light clouded blond beer.
NOSE: fruity, bit sour, some oak, wine like.
TASTE: fruity, little sour, oak.

Bottle at James for his 11k tasting. Pours a hazed gold with a thin white head. Soft lemon, musk, acid on the nose. Medium bodied, soft musk and acid, light tartness moving into grain. Long slow acid and grain on the finish. Slow acid and a bit herbal on the finish.

Location: 750 ml bottle from the brewery, 10/11/15, Blend 1 (6/19/15)


Aroma: The aroma is the pinot barrels, oak, some fruit and wheat, and a little green apple

Appearance: Slightly hazed yellowish-good with a fizzy white head and light, spotty lace

Flavor: The taste is fruity and a little grassy, tart, the red wine and oak are more subtle

Palate: This one is medium bodied, bright and drinkable with a lovely carbonation

Overall Impression: 
This is quite interesting. Its a kinda fruity and bright beer with a freshness to it thats fairly unexpected. Yet it also has an oaked / aged feel too. Theres a lot going on here, rather complex. The more I drink of it the better I think it works. Most of the time a 5 oz sample is plenty to get a feel for a beer, but this is one of those exceptions to the rule. I needed a lot more to decide that this is a really nice, complex, skillfully created brew. Really nicely done.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2015 Bottle shared with Leighton et al. It pours hazy orange with a small white head. The nose is fresh, juicy, gin action, juniper, creaminess, floral, wood, orange peel and earth. The taste is crisp, sweet - sour, funky, minerals, orange sherbet, booze, some alcohol heat, acidity, lime zest, wood, pepper, G & T, white grape and chewy wood with a boozy finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Crazy stuff. Bizarre, but rather nice.
Bottle. Pours cloudy yellow gold. Nose and taste of gin, oak, Pinot, red wine, lemon and sour citrus - medium body
Rating #4900. Bottle. Golden pour with white head. Wine, gin, oak and fruit, tart aromas. Gin, wine, oak, fruit and tart.
nice nice stuff. on tap at the OEC sour fest, lots of spices and grassy flavors fromthe gin bottles, the base is a grainy,, wheaty lightly soured saison-blonde ale type beer. Finish is gin.

750ml bottle shared thanks to sleepydave! Pours hazy pale straw yellow with 2 finger fizzy head. Nose is nice mix of herbal earthy funk, spruce, lemon, musty tartness, light grain. Taste is tart with just a small hint of sharpness, balanced earthy wet grains and hay with funky lemon, low bitterness, some oak, grassy herbs and light evergreen. Finishes tart, dry, lemon, musty citrus, wet cheese, greens. Tasty!

Draught at OEC SourFest, 8/15/15.Another golden-blonde ale, with good clarity (light haze) and a small but fairly well-retained white head.The gin botanicals come out quite prominently in the nose, but, importantly, they arent harsh nor are there any astringent, dominant wood tannins. Rather, light honey/bread-like malt notes join light vanilla and soft, floral and tart acids to yield the first gin-barrel beer I actually like. I will say, the gin sorta sits there front and center, but that seems to be the case with all of the gin-beers Ive tried so I guess thats just par for the course. But the good acidity, malt and moderate funk do enough to add complexity to the nose. No alcohol or flaw noted.The flavor is less given to the gin/botanicals. Theyre certainly there, but a proper maltiness adds a supple texture while ample carbonation helps maintain levity and the the acidity levels are enjoyable but not overdone. No grainy wood character or booziness and quite drinkable. Would love some more of this (couldnt buy a bottle of everything, sadly...)

Cool beer is definitely interesting. Draft at the brewery is hazy straw color with minimal head. Carbonation is on the low end with flabby mouthfeel. Aroma is grainy, lemon, gin, vinous, and earthy. Taste is tart and moderately sweet. Interesting stuff.

On tap at the brewery. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of sourness, some pale malts, light oak, some wheat, and some light fruits and citrus. Flavor the same with a nice blend. Average texture. A solid beer.
